Confidence intervals for
differences of standardized regression slopes
are generated using
the `DiffBetaNB()` function from the `betaNB` package.
In this example,
we use the data set and the model used in
[betaNB: Example Using the BetaNB Function](example-beta-nb.html).


``` r
library(betaNB)
```




``` r
df <- betaNB::nas1982
```

### Regression

Fit the regression model using the `lm()` function.


``` r
object <- lm(QUALITY ~ NARTIC + PCTGRT + PCTSUPP, data = df)
```

### Nonparametric Bootstrap


``` r
nb <- NB(object)
```

### Differences of Standardized Regression Slopes

#### Normal-Theory Approach


``` r
out <- DiffBetaNB(nb, alpha = 0.05)
```

## Methods

### summary

Summary of the results of `DiffBetaNB()`.

#### Percentile Confidence Intervals


``` r
summary(out, type = "pc")
#> Call:
#> DiffBetaNB(object = nb, alpha = 0.05)
#> 
#> Differences of standardized regression slopes
#> type = "pc"
#>                   est     se    R    2.5%  97.5%
#> NARTIC-PCTGRT  0.1037 0.1333 5000 -0.1568 0.3788
#> NARTIC-PCTSUPP 0.2319 0.1236 5000  0.0007 0.4889
#> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP 0.1282 0.1287 5000 -0.1182 0.3910
```

#### Bias Corrected Confidence Intervals


``` r
summary(out, type = "bc")
#> Call:
#> DiffBetaNB(object = nb, alpha = 0.05)
#> 
#> Differences of standardized regression slopes
#> type = "bc"
#>                   est     se    R    2.5%  97.5%
#> NARTIC-PCTGRT  0.1037 0.1333 5000 -0.1637 0.3663
#> NARTIC-PCTSUPP 0.2319 0.1236 5000  0.0006 0.4877
#> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP 0.1282 0.1287 5000 -0.1102 0.3997
```

#### Bias Corrected and Accelerated Confidence Intervals


``` r
summary(out, type = "bca")
#> Call:
#> DiffBetaNB(object = nb, alpha = 0.05)
#> 
#> Differences of standardized regression slopes
#> type = "bca"
#>                   est     se    R    2.5%  97.5%
#> NARTIC-PCTGRT  0.1037 0.1333 5000 -0.1646 0.3655
#> NARTIC-PCTSUPP 0.2319 0.1236 5000 -0.0016 0.4827
#> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP 0.1282 0.1287 5000 -0.0993 0.4186
```

### coef

Return the vector of estimates.


``` r
coef(out)
#>  NARTIC-PCTGRT NARTIC-PCTSUPP PCTGRT-PCTSUPP 
#>      0.1036564      0.2318974      0.1282410
```

### vcov

Return the sampling covariance matrix.


``` r
vcov(out)
#>                NARTIC-PCTGRT NARTIC-PCTSUPP PCTGRT-PCTSUPP
#> NARTIC-PCTGRT    0.017781178    0.008257347   -0.009523831
#> NARTIC-PCTSUPP   0.008257347    0.015289221    0.007031875
#> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP  -0.009523831    0.007031875    0.016555706
```

### confint

Return confidence intervals.

#### Percentile Confidence Intervals


``` r
confint(out, level = 0.95, type = "pc")
#>                       2.5 %    97.5 %
#> NARTIC-PCTGRT  -0.156782155 0.3787550
#> NARTIC-PCTSUPP  0.000738926 0.4889070
#> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP -0.118198337 0.3910228
```

#### Bias Corrected Confidence Intervals


``` r
confint(out, level = 0.95, type = "bc")
#>                       2.5 %    97.5 %
#> NARTIC-PCTGRT  -0.163671021 0.3663359
#> NARTIC-PCTSUPP  0.000615716 0.4876798
#> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP -0.110239258 0.3997487
```

#### Bias Corrected and Accelerated Confidence Intervals


``` r
confint(out, level = 0.95, type = "bca")
#>                       2.5 %    97.5 %
#> NARTIC-PCTGRT  -0.164553751 0.3655152
#> NARTIC-PCTSUPP -0.001647251 0.4826977
#> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP -0.099339229 0.4185874
```
